page.title: 05Enfield Transport
page.content: Enfield is for many a commuter town. Its transport network links it not only with London, but also with towns like Cambridge & Hertford. Little Park Gardens bus terminus is busy & impor- tant, serving the following buses:29, W2,217b,310,316,360,191 &231. Enfield Town railway station was built in 1849 to join with the Eastern Counties line at Edmonton. The station was origin- ally a school. This was demolished in 1872 and a new station built. The line runs from Enfield Town to Liverpool St.. In peak hours 4/5 trains leave Enfield Town every hour. Enfield Chase station opened in April 1871, part of the Great Northern Railway. It was a terminus - in 1910 the line was extended to Cuffley & a new station built lower down Windmill Hill. Now the line runs from Hertford North into Moorgate, with up to 6 trains an hour.
